headline.main: Deadly Stampede at an Ethiopian Festival

docs.snippet: Police fired on antigovernment demonstrators at a religious festival in Bishoftu earlier this month, triggering a stampede that killed more than 50 people....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police fired on antigovernment demonstrators at a religious festival in Bishoftu earlier this month, triggering a stampede that killed more than 50 people.

headline.main: McCain Suggests GOP Would Oppose Clinton Supreme Court Picks
headline.print_headline: McCain Suggests GOP Would Oppose Clinton Supreme Court Picks

docs.snippet: Sen. John McCain pledged Monday that Republicans will unite against any Supreme Court nominee that Hillary Clinton puts forward if she becomes president, forecasting obstruction that could tie Capitol Hill in knots....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sen. John McCain pledged Monday that Republicans will unite against any Supreme Court nominee that Hillary Clinton puts forward if she becomes president, forecasting obstruction that could tie Capitol Hill in knots.

headline.main: Bravo's Heroics in Vain as Pakistan Win Day-Night Test
headline.print_headline: Bravo's Heroics in Vain as Pakistan Win Day-Night Test

docs.snippet: A heroic and historic century from Darren Bravo put West Indies in sight of the unlikeliest win in the first test in Dubai on Monday before Pakistan finally prevailed by 56 runs on an absorbing final day of the day-night contest....
docs.lead_paragraph: A heroic and historic century from Darren Bravo put West Indies in sight of the unlikeliest win in the first test in Dubai on Monday before Pakistan finally prevailed by 56 runs on an absorbing final day of the day-night contest.

headline.main: Official: At Least 23 Die in Hospital Fire in Eastern India
headline.print_headline: Official: At Least 23 Die in Hospital Fire in Eastern India

docs.snippet: A fire broke out late Monday at a private hospital in a city in eastern India, killing at least 23 people, India's federal health minister said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A fire broke out late Monday at a private hospital in a city in eastern India, killing at least 23 people, India's federal health minister said.

headline.main: Rich Nations Say on Track for Promised $100 Billion Climate Finance
headline.print_headline: Rich Nations Say on Track for Promised $100 Billion Climate Finance

docs.snippet: Rich countries said on Monday they were on track to keep a promise to provide developing nations with $100 billion a year to tackle climate change by 2020, up from an estimated $62 billion in 2014....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rich countries said on Monday they were on track to keep a promise to provide developing nations with $100 billion a year to tackle climate change by 2020, up from an estimated $62 billion in 2014.

headline.main: Russian Plan for 8-Hour Halt in Aleppo Attacks Too Little, Too Late-U.S.
headline.print_headline: Russian Plan for 8-Hour Halt in Aleppo Attacks Too Little, Too Late-U.S.

docs.snippet: A Russian plan to halt Russian and Syrian attacks on Aleppo for eight hours on Thursday to allow civilians and rebels to leave the Syrian city is too little, too late, the U.S. State Department said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Russian plan to halt Russian and Syrian attacks on Aleppo for eight hours on Thursday to allow civilians and rebels to leave the Syrian city is too little, too late, the U.S. State Department said on Monday.

headline.main: Thief of Advil Gets Jail for His 12th Shoplifting Conviction
headline.print_headline: Thief of Advil Gets Jail for His 12th Shoplifting Conviction

docs.snippet: A Pennsylvania man has been jailed for stealing a $4.49 bottle of Advil because it was the 12th time he's been convicted of shoplifting....
